metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15682 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
When a link to an external protocol was clicked, a prompt was presented that allowed the user to choose what application to open it in. An attacker could induce that prompt to be associated with an origin they didn't control, resulting in a spoofing attack. This was fixed by changing external protocol prompts to be tab-modal while also ensuring they could not be incorrectly associated with a different origin. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 82.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15682` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
